intro: Fumaria agraria var. platycarpa, commonly known as the broad-fruitedcelandine, is a flowering plant belonging to the poppy family, Papaveraceae. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and alternate, heart-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in early summer, followed by elongated, cylindrical seed pods. Its fruits, known as follicles, are distinctive for their broad, flattened shape and contain numerous small, dark seeds. This species is typically found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of habitats, including roadsides and waste areas.
